songs.full_title: Adiós by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Adiós

description.plain:
Adiós es la sexta pista del primer proyecto en español de Selena Gomez, Revelación.

La pista habla sobre un Adiós definitivo a una relación de cualquier tipo, habla sobre eliminar toda la toxicidad y seguir con la vida.

  


[English]

Adiós is the sixth track from Selena Gomez’s first Spanish project Revelación.

The track talks about a final goodbye to a relationship of any kind, talks about eliminating all toxicity and moving on with life.

songs.title: All Night Long

description.plain: “All Night Long” was a purposely terrible song, dubbed as Selena’s “debut single” on her YouTube. Selena sings and plays guitar, accompanied by Wizards of Waverly Place costar Jennifer Stone. The freestyle gives off a death-metal vibe and isn’t meant to be taken seriously.

songs.full_title: Anxiety by Julia Michaels (Ft. Selena Gomez)
songs.title: Anxiety

description.plain:
“Anxiety” is the intro to Michaels' second studio EP, Inner Monologue.

Michaels has always been vocal about her mental health problems, and even wrote a touching piece about anxiety for the magazine Glamour.

Michaels shared a demo of the song with Rolling Stone, who described it as a “campfire strum supported by a heartbeat bassline”.

In the song, produced by longtime collaborator and Grammy winner producer Ian Kirkpatrick, Michaels sings her personal experience on living with anxiety, her sleepless nights, hearing from exes and refusing her doctor’s advice to take medicine.

songs.full_title: A Sweeter Place by Selena Gomez (Ft. Kid Cudi)
songs.title: A Sweeter Place

description.plain:
“A Sweeter Place” is a Contemporary R&B collaboration with American rapper Kid Cudi. Both artists sing about wanting to find “a sweeter place” to keep their worries “all away.”

Although it is unclear when the pair first met and decided to collaborate, they took a photo together back in November 3, 2019, at ComplexCon.

Prior to the song’s official release, a snippet of it was heard in the album trailer for her third studio album, Rare, posted to her social media platforms on December 12, 2019.

songs.full_title: Back To You by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Back To You

description.plain:
“Back to You” is an upbeat love ballad that sees Selena sing her heart out and express her love for her significant other, even though that person may be able to hurt her again.

The song was first teased through a leaked Spotify advertisement. Lyrics for the song were previewed on Selena Gomez’s Instagram leading up to its premiere on Zane Lowe’s World Record feature on Apple Music’s Beats 1 radio station.

The promotion for the song prominently featured polaroid photographs. This was likely directly influenced by 13 Reasons Why—photographs play a large role in the trailer for season two.

songs.full_title: Bad Liar by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Bad Liar

description.plain:
According to co-writer Justin Tranter, “Bad Liar” is about “trying to hide magical feelings for someone new, but not being able to.”

The track is the latest single from Selena Gomez released on May 18, 2017. Although it is not yet linked to any project, it could be a first single for one.

The track interpolates the bassline of Talking Heads‘ 1977 classic “Psycho Killer."

For more on the lyrics, check the official premiere article here: https://genius.com/a/selena-gomez-premieres-the-lyrics-to-her-new-single-bad-liar

description.plain: An unreleased song by Selena Gomez, presumably titled “Bang,” originally meant to be included on the 2014 album “For You.”  After years of multiple snippets surfacing on the internet, the song was fully leaked on September 24, 2020.

songs.full_title: Birthday by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Birthday

description.plain:
“Birthday” is the first track on Stars Dance. True to its form, the record was released around Selena’s real birthday.

This track was written and produced by Mike Del Rio with additional writing from Crista Russo and Jacob Kasher Hindlin.

Musically, “Birthday” combines deep electronic dance beats and police sirens with elements of trap music. The songs instrumentation is created by blending purring, synthesized bass, snappy beats, handclaps, “oxygen-sucking” sub-bass, and trap snares with sexual moans and elements of hip hop music

This song influences girl power with risqué lyrics, Happy Birthday Sel!

songs.full_title: Body Heat by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Body Heat

description.plain:
“Body Heat” is a song from Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.

During an track-by-track interview on Twitter, she told that the song was recorded in Mexico with Hit-Boy. “It was full on inspired by the culture. I thought it was important for me to have a song on the album that represented that side of me.” As her father is of Mexican descent.

songs.full_title: Boyfriend by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Boyfriend

description.plain:
“Boyfriend” is a song by American singer Selena Gomez which appears on the deluxe edition of her third studio album Rare. The song was released as the first single from the deluxe edition and fourth overall from the album

Gomez and a friend first teased “Boyfriend” on an Instagram livestream the day of Rare’s release on January 10, 2020.

songs.full_title: Buscando Amor by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Buscando Amor

description.plain:
Buscando Amor es la segunda pista del primer proyecto en español de Selena Gomez, Revelación.

La pista es sobre empoderamiento femenino, habla sobre tener confianza y tener diversión sin buscar una relación seria.

songs.full_title: Calm Down (Remix) by Rema (Ft. Selena Gomez)
songs.title: Calm Down (Remix)

description.plain:
In “Calm Down,” Rema talks about his attraction to a certain female despite his reluctance to approach her, while Selena Gomez provides the feminine perspective, as she also discusses the influence she has on her significant other.

Following the success of “Calm Down,” which peaked at #57 on the Billboard Global Excl. U.S. Chart, Rema enlists Gomez for the remix version. Gomez teased it via a video in which she and Rema are seen backstage during his Rave & Roses album Tour while articulating her appreciation of being featured on the Remix. On August 17, 2022, Gomez posted a snapshot in her Instagram story of herself, and Rema in what looked to be as if they were in the studio, as she wrote the phrase “coming soon.”

songs.title: Camouflage

description.plain:
“Camouflage” is a song from Selena Gomez' second solo album Revival, which was released on 9 October 2015.

During a track-by-track interview on Twitter, she said:

It’s the only ballad on the entire album. I wanted to do that on purpose, because this was me pouring my heart into something, it’s very honest and real.

songs.full_title: Come & Get It by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Come & Get It

description.plain:
“Come & Get It” is a song recorded by American singer Selena Gomez for her debut solo album Stars Dance.

The song was written by Ester Dean, M.S. Eriksen, and T.E. Hermansen and was produced by Stargate. Meanwhile, the vocals were produced by Dreamlab. The song features elements of electropop and even Indian music.

Gomez stated:

I just remember recording it and being in the studio and just thinking of how the place I was in and what I was going through and I was just so excited about it and I wanted it to be the first single.

description.plain:
“Complicated” is an unreleased song by Summer Walker that was later pitched to Selena Gomez for a collaboration; however, both versions were later scrapped. It’s unknown for what project this version of the song was intended to.
The track was leaked on January 9, 2021.

songs.full_title: Continents by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Continents

description.plain:
“Continents” is an unreleased song by Selena Gomez. It’s recorded in 2017 and it’s unreleased for Selena’s unreleased album in 2017/18. The demo by
Madison Love got leaked on March 28, 2021. Selena Gomez recorded a demo but that version hasn’t leaked yet.

songs.full_title: Cut You Off by Selena Gomez
songs.title: Cut You Off

description.plain:
“Cut You Off” is a midtempo track from Selena Gomez’s third studio album, Rare. The song is about someone moving on from a past relationship and feeling better about themselves.

It was revealed by the co-writer Liza Owen via Instagram that the song was written about an “asshole boy who shall not be named.” This led to many speculating it was about her ex-boyfriend, Justin Bieber. Interestingly, “Cut You Off” is the only explicit track released on Rare.

The song was first teased back in an interview with ELLE on September 4, 2018, where she “[hit] ‘play’ on [the track].” The interviewer, Mickey Rapkin, even described the song:

[It’s] about cutting a man out of her life after “1,460 days” and [cleaning her slate].

A snippet of the song was first teased on December 12, 2019, when Selena uploaded an album trailer for Rare on her social media platforms.

songs.full_title: Dámelo To' by Selena Gomez (Ft. Myke Towers)
songs.title: Dámelo To’

description.plain:
Dámelo To' es la cuarta pista del primer proyecto en español de Selena Gomez, Revelación.

La pista habla sobre estar en control en la relación y también sobre actuar y terminar con eso, en un ámbito sexual.

  


[English]

Dámelo To' is the fourth track from Selena Gomez’s first Spanish project Revelación.

The track talks about being in control in the relationship and also about acting and ending it, in a sexual realm.
